result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Danyell Lamont Johnson

Defendant Danyell Lamont Johnson not in court, in custody.  Attorney Nicole A. Muller in court for Danyell Lamont Johnson.  Attorney John J Rejowski in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for status conference.  Case is in trial posture, defense counsel requests case be placed on the trial calendar.  Pretrial Scheduling Order, signed and filed. Case adjourned to Branch 11.
Final pre-trial scheduled for February 24, 2023 at 08:30 am.
Jury trial scheduled for April 11, 2023 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Danyell Lamont Johnson not in court, in custody at HOC.  Attorney Nicole A. Muller in court for Danyell Lamont Johnson.  Prosecuting attorney John J Rejowski in court for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for status conference. Defense informs the court that she has just received discovery and requests another status hearing date. Court grants requests.
Status conference scheduled for November 1, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Notice of Appearance.  Received and Filed.  nk

Attorney Nicole A. Muller in court, defendant Danyell Lamont Johnson not in court, in custody.  Patrick J Anderson appeared for Megan Newport the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Muller is new counsel on the case and requested time to review case with defendant.   Court ordered case adjourned for status conference in Branch 25.   All parties are notified that effective July 30, 2022 this case will be assigned to Judge David Swanson, Branch 11, in Room 316 of the Safety Building.  Status conference scheduled for September 6, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Atty. Muller contacted the court and accepted the appointment.

Clerk:  jms
Status conference scheduled for July 12, 2022 at 09:00 am.

BRANCH 28 for BRANCH 25:

Defendant Danyell Lamont Johnson (appears via Zoom video), in custody.  John J Rejowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin (appears in person).
Defendant has four cases before the court.
Case is scheduled on today's date for status of counsel.
Counsel has not yet been appointed as to these cases.

Court will appoint counsel for Defendant.  The Court appoints Attorney Nicole Muller to represent defendant at the rate of $100 per hour;  Attorney Muller NOT present in court but will be contacted by the deputy clerk as to the appointment. 

Court did not rule as to whether defendant is to repay as to legal expenses; Court to address on the next court date.

Court ordered case adjourned for Status of Counsel in Branch 25.  

Per Chief Judge Directive 22-04 effective July 30, 2022, this calendar will be assigned to Judge David Swanson, Branch 11 in Room 316 of the Safety Bldg.

Clerk:  jms

Defendant Danyell Lamont Johnson in court with attorney Annamarie Amy Wineke.  Defendant Danyell Lamont Johnson in custody.  Megan Marie Newport appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for a status conference. Attorney Annamarie Wineke informs court that due to reasons stated on the record, defense requests to withdraw from the case.  Motion of the defense counsel to withdraw granted by the Court.  Attorney is to inform the Public Defender's Office that new counsel needs to be appointed.  Case is adjourned for status of counsel to Branch 28.
Per Chief Judge Directive 22-04 effective June 13, 2022, this calendar will be assigned to Reserve Judge John Franke, in Room 608 of the Courthouse.  Status conference scheduled for June 28, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Received and Filed. Notice and Motion to Withdraw.

Defendant has a hearing scheduled for May 27, 2022.  
Defense counsel is requesting this case be adjourned to the same date; no objection by the State.
This case is adjourned to May 27, 2022 for status in Branch 28.

Clerk:  jms
Received and Filed. Letter to Judge

Attorney Annamarie Amy Wineke in court, defendant Danyell Lamont Johnson not in court, in custody.  Ian F Vance-Curzan and Megan Newport appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  All parties appear in person.
Parties in court on today's date as to Case# 20CF02658.

This case remains scheduled for status in Branch 28.

Clerk:  jms

Defense counsel is requesting sentencing be transferred to Branch 46 and PSI report be quashed.
Case is adjourned for further proceedings in Branch 28 on March 18, 2022

Clerk:  jms

Attorney Annamarie Amy Wineke in court, defendant Danyell Lamont Johnson not in court, in custody.  Alexander James Geocaris appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for Scheduling conference.  The scheduling conference was held OFF THE RECORD.  The court order the matter adjourned back to Branch 28.
 
  Status conference scheduled for May 18, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Danyell Lamont Johnson in court with attorney Annamarie Amy Wineke.  Defendant Danyell Lamont Johnson in custody.  Matthew Zisi appeared for the State of Wisconsin. PARTIES APPEAR BY VIDEO. 
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: P.O. Seng Xiong - MPD. Court took judicial notice of defendants pending matters regarding Milwaukee County cases #20CF2658, 20CF773, and Fond du Lac County case 21CF805.   State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 28.  Scheduling conference scheduled for March 4, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Attorney Annamarie Amy Wineke in court, defendant Danyell Lamont Johnson not in court, in custody.  John Daniel Flynn appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  PARTIES APPEAR BY VIDEO.
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness was present. Parties jointly request an adjournment. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  

This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  
https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/

Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 18, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Notice Of Motion To Adjourn - received

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for Level 5 Supervision with Electronic Monitoring; 24 hour curfew.  If electronic monitoring device is unavailable and cash bail has been paid, bail to revert to $25,000.  If Alternative bail is paid, Defendant to be released and placed on Electronic Monitoring waiting list.

Defendant Danyell Lamont Johnson in court with attorney Joseph Thomas Domask.  Defendant Danyell Lamont Johnson in custody.  Kimberly Dorice Schoepp appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Danyell Lamont Johnson appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Sanders, Branch 28. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  Defense enters a plea of NOT GUILTY as to misdemeanor counts 7, 8 and 9.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  

This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:
